alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:22PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Isle of Wight and the central City of Suffolk through 400 PM EST... At 322 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holland, moving north at 30 mph. This storm has a history of producing rotation and may intensify. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Windsor, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Rescue, Kings Fork, Crittenden, Carrollton, Longview, Benns Church, Lummis, Wills Corner, Bethel Church, Chuckatuck, Indika, Lawson, Hobson, Mogarts Beach and Rushmere. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for southeastern Virginia.
